title: 60% of Latino voters say think country is on wrong track: New polls
shortDescription: Two polls of Latino voters say they believe the United States is heading in the wrong direction and hold Trump and his administration responsible.

title: New poll show Trump's low approval rating
shortDescription: Less than half of Americans approve of President Donald Trump in his first 100 days, a new NPR/PBS News/Marist poll show.

title: Trump says China will 'probably' absorb tariff costs in ABC interview
shortDescription: "You don't know whether or not China's going to eat it," Trump said of the potential for tariffs on Chinese goods to increase consumer prices.

title: President Trump holds 100 days rally in Michigan
shortDescription: President Donald Trump celebrates his first 100 days in office in Michigan, one of the swing states that helped bring him back to the White House in 2024.

title: Trump and Bezos make peace (again) after Amazon tariff tiff
shortDescription: President Donald Trump's budding friendship with Amazon founder Jeff Bezos hit a snag as the retailer considers how to respond to tariffs.

title: Trump to sit down with ABC for 100 days interview: How to watch
shortDescription: ABC will air an exclusive interview with President Donald Trump about his first 100 days in office on April 29. Here's how to tune in.

title: Eric Trump announces Trump tower in Dubai
shortDescription: Eric Trump promoted a new Trump tower in Dubai that will feature a hotel, apartments and "the tallest swimming pool in the world."

title: Trump hosts rally in Michigan to commemorate 100 days: Watch live
shortDescription: President Donald Trump is set to celebrate his first 100 days in Michigan, one of the swing states that helped bring him back to the White House.

title: How the Latino vote helped propel Trump to victory
shortDescription: A big swing toward Trump among Latino voters, particularly men, helped him win the presidency.

title: Trump's approval rating at 42% in new poll released on 100th day
shortDescription: A new NPR/PBS News/Marist poll released April 29 found 42% of respondents approved of President Donald Trump's job.

title: Men vs. women: Gen Z voters divided in politics, polls find
shortDescription: A new poll by NBC found young women were more likely to lean left, while their male counterparts were more likely to go right.

title: Trump administration dismisses volunteer climate assessment authors
shortDescription: The Trump administration notified authors of the National Climate Assessment that the congressionally mandated process is on hold.

title: Congress works on Trump’s ‘big beautiful bill’
shortDescription: Lawmakers returned from break to hammer out the details of President Donald Trump’s legislative agenda.

title: Trump offers automakers some relief from 25% tariffs
shortDescription: President Trump is offering automakers rebates for a portion of the tariffs on auto parts that automakers import to build vehicles in the U.S.

title: Virginia Democrat Gerry Connolly won't seek reelection
shortDescription: Gerry Connolly said he will not seek reelection and will step back from his role on the House Oversight Committee after learning his cancer has returned.

title: Carney wins Canada's election | The Excerpt
shortDescription: Plus: It's been 100 days in office for President Donald Trump.

title: Amazon denies plans to list tariff prices after Trump calls Bezos
shortDescription: President Trump personally called Jeff Bezos after reading about reported plans for Amazon to list tariff prices. Amazon denied the plans.

title: Carney rides Canadian fury at Trump to victory
shortDescription: Mark Carney won the Canadian election to retain power as prime minister.

title: Daily Briefing: Trump's 100-day grade
shortDescription: New poll shows a majority of Americans disapprove of Trump's job so far. Here is the news to know on Tuesday.

title: Trump admin probes Harvard and its law review for 'race-based discrimination'
shortDescription: President Donald Trump's administration said it was probing whether Harvard University and the Harvard Law Review violated civil rights laws.

title: What to know as Congress starts writing sweeping Trump priorities bill
shortDescription: Expect tricky political battles ahead over the massive tax and spending bill.

title: Elon Musk takes a backseat as Donald Trump reaches 100 days
shortDescription: Elon Musk burst into Trump's White House as the chainsaw-wielding government slasher. But 100 days into Trump's term, his role is diminishing.
